pros: For a small hospital, they are trying to serve the community well. It is nice to see new expansions to meet mental health needs.
cons: Insurance premiums aren't stellar, for a medical company offering it's employees coverage.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Holland, MI
pros: Peaceful and clean environment, small town vibe, standard of excellence throughout the organization, fair assignments with good nurse-to-patient ratio.
cons: VSP is down-staffed often, no increased pay for VSP (equivalent to a PRN position), only 30 minutes to get to the unit once called in, incentive pay opportunities are poor compared to other hospitals I’ve worked at.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Holland, MI
pros: It is a Great place to work
cons: Not a lot of room for advancement

pros: Good culture, teamwork, formerly good ratios. Seemed genuine in trying to improve diversity. Genuine care from most people including middle management/educators.
cons: Pay not competitive. I had to leave to make market rate. Changed pays scales sometime between 2010 and 2017 and now no way to get top of range in less than 15 years. The hourly rate of nurses hired before 2010 is fair but those hired after is not. Raises are like a dollar or less a year even with 5/5 evals. Too much money spent on HR initiatives that are clueless about what it is like at the bedside. Waste of money for useless tasks that take us away from the patients. Good place for new grads though. Good preceptors/orientations. I heard new grads are now making a market rate and make more than some of the nurses preceptors. Yikes!

pros: Very ethically bound management team and wants to do the right thing
cons: Salary is not competitive compared to others in the area

review_title: What I think of Holland Hospital
pros: Holland Hospital is a very family, friendly atmosphere with people who care about one another and their patients.  They also have great benefits such as PTO and BTO (paid time off and birthday time off) and give us bonuses throughout the year.
cons: Hard to change jobs within the hospital without experience in that field.  Working in Housekeeping I feel like we should get paid more because we often have to clean up after people who have had diseases.  There is other places who get paid more than us and they don't deal with cleaning up diseases and serious illnesses.  It is also hard to get into a different department when you don't have experience.  They should also think of classes that people have taken.

review_title: What Happened to the Fish Philosophy?
pros:
PTO Accrual 
Education Benefits
Diversity
401K and Empoyer Match up to 6% of 50% of Wage
Goal Share (when it happens)
Making "Their Day" to a Patient, Visitor or Team Member
Encouragement and Team Effort from co-workers
cons:
Upper Management is Out of Touch (take a walk in our shoes and you'll learn alot)
Low Morale Abounds 
Lack of Goal Share - Hands Washed? Wellness Participation Web MD?
G.S. Fairness? (peer pressure used to punish those that participate vs those who choose not to)
Yearly Evaluations process needs to be Evaluated
Bonuses are rare for the majority of Employees
Lack of Encouragement or Support  from Upper Management  
Low Staffing due to high rate of Turnover

pros:
Gives good PTO time for vacations. Does give college reimbursements, when you pass classes.
Have made some great friendships. The only hospital in Holland.
cons: Where to start, upper management teaches middle management to bully other employees. To much middle management that each has different rules , so you don't know who to listen to for  guidance. No real written practices for the whole of the hospital, each department decides how they are doing vacation time, who gets what job. Nothing based on qualifications but who is your buddy.

job_title: Desktop Support Tech in Holland, MI
pros:
Decent pay
Location 
Small hospital feel
You feel good going into work because you're helping people at the worst. But that could be said of any hospital...
cons: Great place to learn how not to manage people. Like  a lot of reviews on here I'll parrot that that place is backwards and not forward thinking. You'll get placed on an off shift because no one will want it and end up there for years. Reviews will be skewed down and accomplishments overlooked to keep you on that shift. Management doesn't want the best person for each job... They just want warm bodies that don't expect anything from them.

job_title: Patient Care Assistant in Holland, MI
pros: The people - it’s always the people, and healthcare has some of the best!
cons: As always, working in a hospital requires 24/7 service so working off-shifts, weekends, and holidays are required. As per usual in healthcare, the profit margin at the hospital level is slim so bonuses and incentive pay are few and far between. This particular hospital sometimes gets caught up in an atmosphere of non-judgment so raises aren’t always based on performance.

review_title: Toxic work environment, management ignored bullying, newer managers targeted several veteran workers and fired them.
pros: Beautiful hospital, better than average cafeteria
cons: What once was a pleasant place to work (17 yrs ago) eventually devolved into a very hostile place to work.  The corrective actions process not fair and too open to bias, personal preference rather than across the board equality.  Basically, if you have a manager that didn't like you, your days are numbered.  They will find a way to get rid of you or fire you (and no unemployment benefits).  Does not value years of service or loyalty.  Lots of red tape and competition with Spectrum Health.  You are no longer a valued employee, you are a number and expendable at any time.

pros: Work-life balance is good unless they determine otherwise.
cons:
Leadership only visible for negative interactions
Teamwork, when needed, is forced and micro-managed.

pros:
Pays well, better than most other hospitals in the area
Friendly coworkers
Yearly bonus
cons: Lots of employees from many departments (management, interpreters, nursing, aids) let go recently with no notice or severance because the hospital didn't reach patient growth goals

pros: Excellent Leadership and High Quality Healthcare. The hospital truly lives out the mission, vision, and values. The hospital strives to care for the community in an affordable and efficient manner
cons: None to Report. The hospital and health system have been a tremendous fulfillment for me and my family. I encourage continued commitment to achieving what the hospital stand for

pros: Holland Hospital has been in business a long time... benefits and paid time off are good
cons:
Double standards exist everywhere. For instance... our department has an requirement that we all work every other weekend... that is except if you are a group lead or  the department manager. Group leads never have to work the evenings or weekends... therefore they never know how difficult it is to complete the required amount of work in the allotted time. Weekends and nights we are already short staffed so when someone calls in it is more difficult. Rarely do the groups leads come in to help when we are short... although on occasion they do. 
Department manager is a different story. NEVER will the department manager come in to help on a weekend or an evening.... no matter how short staffed we are. Her job is scheduling for the dept but each and every month there are holes in the schedule where no one is scheduled to do a specific job... we are just left to figure it out. 
Holidays... staff can never get extra time off at a holiday but the department manager almost ALWAYS takes extra time with every holiday.
Double standards all over the place. Some people are quite often late or call in... it is for the most part overlooked while those who are always on time or always there and work extra when needed are treated unfairly.
Departments all over the hospital are recognized by their managers while this department is rarely recognized or even a pat on the back for that matter

review_title: Now I Know Why Unions Were Created
pros:
Small town hospital.
Made some Have some great employees who really care about the patients and how they are taken care of from food servers, housekeeping ,nurses and lab personal.
cons:
Small town hospital has a double edged sword, small enough to give personal care, but also won't spend the money they have to come up to the current medical advancements. Give PTO, but have to use it for when your sick. Really the employees are exposed to all the germs and virus's and this place won't even give employee's sick days.
The way this place is run, it still is back in the 60's, now I  know why union's were made.

pros: Some would say pto adds up fast, You don't get any sick days so really PTO gets used up fast.
cons: Management, They push as much on you as they can. You never get a good word for working so hard. We work like we are three people and get paid less than one.
